title: Banks offering special loans for earthquake repairs
author: Unknown
text: Banks in the region are offering special loans to assist businesses and individuals affected by Wednesday's earthquake: ** Wells Fargo Bank is offering emergency loans to small businesses. Those that qualify are eligible for no-fee, below-prime-rate loans of up to $100,000 to repair facilities and replace damaged inventory. Information is available at 206-292-3123. ** Bank of America has set up loan programs and services for victims of the quake. Loans with flexible terms and below-market rates are available to qualified borrowers. Loans will be processed on a priority basis, with payment extensions and loan modifications. Customers should contact their bank or a "client relationship" manager. ** U.S. Bank has launched an emergency-loan program for building repairs and other quake-related damage. Details of the program are being worked out. ** Washington Mutual said customers may be eligible for assistance programs that range from accelerated home-equity loans at reduced rates to flexible mortgage-payment schedules. ** The Small Business Administration in Seattle said it is awaiting word from the federal government on providing emergency loans.
